An Internet story has been sent out to many pet breed memberships and animal support group Web sites and mailing lists concerning the Swiffer Wetjet.
The story alleges that the Swiffer Wetjet contains harmful chemicals that can kill a pet due to liver failure. I have received telephone calls, letters and e-mails as to whether the story is true. The answer is no. ... The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals has weighed in on the issue, and is working with the parent company Proctor and Gamble to dispel the e-mail's unfounded allegation. According to the ASPCA's Animal Poison Control Center, the Swiffer WetJet System contains water (90-100 percent), propylene glycol n-propyl ether and isopropyl alcohol (1-4 percent).
